title: Why are you the rank you are?
body:
Hey all,

I'm looking for a bit of constructive criticism. I'm in the process of creating a website that helps you see **why** you are the rank you are, and where you could be. **The link is at the bottom of the post**.

There's a lot of cosmetic changes needed. This is just something I threw together (design wise) to get the prototype working.

Is there anyone who is interested in seeing their stats, why they are the rank they are, what they could improve on, and how they match up against their lane opponent and a pro? See screenshot below.

Upon seeing your own report, please feel free to let me know what your opinion is. From the testing I've done, the numbers seem correct. However, anything you see in your report that seems off, let me know. Anything you **don't** see and would like to see, please feel free to request it.

http://www.uploady.com/#!/download/LJuzOwGt2qR/fA1NHL18h6T_~cKA



A few things to note:

The website tries its best to detect if you're tanking or not. If it doesn't detect that you're tanking, yet you're playing the role of tank, it means you should have built more tanky.

The website will still report that you need MR/Armor when you're playing support. I'm toying with the idea of making this less essential for support as you will really only encounter other supports as your adversary. Countering them is pretty pointless armor/resist wise. Let me know what your thoughts on this are particularly, if you don't mind, please. I'd love to see what you've got to say regarding little nuances like this one.

***Updates***

Presently with the selective beta process, I thought it'd be a good time to bring up known bugs:

~~1: Sometimes a random champion will appear as your lane adversary in a match.~~ **Resolved**
2: Some items do not actually properly register stat-wise. If you spot an item that adds armor, for example, and it says you have not built armor, please report it.
3: Support statistics need an overhaul. They'll be a bit inaccurate, and tips will not be entirely true.
4: Damage taken will be a bit skewed for soak-champs like Vladamir.
5: Some **very** unrealistic jumps are being predicted (like Silver to Challenger), especially when stats are dissected and you see your performance has been evaluated as sub-par. This is being evaluated and will be resolved in the near future. Please don't take this as anything more than a bug.


**Please go here to test the website:  http://www.SlashLaugh.com**

replies.body: Seems pretty cool so far. Does it say anything about warding? Wards win games.

Yeah, very intricate details like warding have flown under the radar thus far. It's basically in Alpha stage, but I appreciate the feedback. It will certainly have a **lot** more info in the coming weeks.

I'm presently working on mastery dissection and showing the impact they had as opposed to other masteries one could have chosen.

if you can find out who runs op.gg and ask nicely they may share their setup for wards so you don't have to start from scratch

E: thought op showed total wards, but it doesn't count sightstone, that's riot. Still, better than starting from scratch o.o

Thanks for the suggestion!

The wards are actually all reported by Riot's API, so it's pretty easy to retrieve things like wards bought and wards placed. My main concern is gathering the data from Challengers, getting metrics like Wards Placed Per Min, for example, and testing each player against those. That, also, is decently easy. It's just a matter of getting to it with the mountain of work ahead of me XD

If you can get everything calculated properly this seems like a good resource. Way too many people goin on about how they deserve to be higher "just cus". Maybe if they have something to tell them "no you don't, and here's why, work on these" With as much detail as you seem to be planning, they'll finally accept some constructive criticism :P


Good work so far man, and Gl with the rest of your work.
Sure, I'll give myself a shot.
Here is your report.

Alright, overall, really good. There are some minor bugs/issues though.
1. In my Sion game, it said "You did not built some, but not enough armor, against an AD opponent." while I had Ninja Tabi, Thornmail, and Sunfire. Thats... a lot of armor under any circumstances.
2. In the same Sion game, it noted that I did much less damage than my opponent. Again, this is natural considering I built almost entirely tanky. There should by a rough system to determine "Is this character intending to do damage or not?"
3. In my Miss Fortune game, it says "You did not built armor against an AD opponent." Thats just.... well kind of obvious.
4. A few of the game have my opponent as Janna. This doesn't make too much sense when I was jungling and mid.

But like I said though, this is a pretty cool idea, keep it up!

Looks neat and really does have some potential, problem is it seems a bit confused. It seems to rank games differently every time I hit refresh.

Example, my most recent game it says it is ranked "high silver" then high hit refresh, suddenly the exact same game and stats it ranked "high plat", and all I did was hit refresh. It also seems to rate me randomly.

Example of this is it rated my games, randomly said I was bronze (I'm not in bronze) and said if I continued my trend I would be low bronze. I was like...uh what? So I hit refresh, completely different. Same games, same graph, but below my games were suddenly rated higher, like what I stated above, and suddenly was rating me high silver (I'm currently silver 5, so nothing special). Just curious what's up with this as I'm not really trusting the stats here when hitting refresh seems to tell me two different things (sometimes very different)  about the exact same games/stats.



Edit: Wanted to state, number 1 isn't resolved.

3 of the 10 games shown were showing matchups that I wasn't matched up against (I'm a huge stat nerd and keep track of my own games and those weren't my lane opponents), such as telling me I was matched up against mid laners multiple times saying I did worse when in those games I stomped my lane opponents but my mid laner super fed.


Seems there are still some kinks to work out but number one isn't fixed and the issues I stated above just make it confusing.

Edit 2:

there is also a really odd bug where for a few opponents it was showing them with two sets of items, like one line of items then a completely different grouping of items, as if it was for two different champions.

That's essentially my fault solely. I'm constantly changing the algorithms and rating system to be more accurate. Right now, some portions are more "generic" (I hate that term -- they're still custom to your situation but they're not as **deep** as I want all of them to be). I'm fine-tuning all of the analytics to *really* drill-down on each individual. As that happens, and the programming evolves, your rating(s) will change. Not typically by a huge amount, but they will change.

Which games are showing that you matched up with a mid champ? I'm still working on fixing an obstacle relating to Riot's API. For example, sometimes Riot doesn't actually report who was where. In that case, my program relies solely on a *best guess*. That best guess is constantly being worked on, and I'm making improvements every day, but it's still **far** from perfect. I would like to know which games you're referring to, though, so I can have more data to analyze to aid in correcting the issue.

The item bug is annoying isn't it. It's part of the above bug. I'm very close to having the item bug worked out.

Thanks for the feedback! Anything else you've noticed?

http://www.slashlaugh.com/?s=5908&n=Dyrus Dec 4, 2014 12:53 AM Warwick vs Morgana

"Your damage taken is higher than your adversary's. which is good as a tank. All in all, your damage taken is very high. You appear to have done your job well! **Your lack of a dynamic build most certainly hurt your team, and it appears as though you were carried.**"

The bold part seems to be at odds with the rest of the message.

Similar problem with the game right above it.

I noticed some other bugs inside that match report as well. Thanks for posting that one! That was a gold mine as far as bug reports go.

I've got that message fixed. What I did was disabled low marks for lack of penetration on tanky champs and on tanky builds. Only half got coded out in that circumstance (inadvertently - I was tired XD) and the other half was showing up after the damage taken.

BTW, did you notice the little tooltips inside the notes? If so, what'd you think of them?

Hey there, in http://www.slashlaugh.com/?s=21675619&n=DeathsArt in the Thresh vs Blitzcrank game December 5th @ 2:34 AM it seems to not be detecting Locket of the Iron Solari as a Magic Resist item. The person is my friend and also says he had a Rammus game that wasnt detecting Sunfire Cape as an armor item. 

Love where youre going with the site, graphics look great and its getting really nice with the chart and all. I do miss being able to see at a glance whether i won or lost a match without needing to open it. Maybe tint the graphics red on a loss or simply place "win" or "loss" on the collapsed info?

Thanks for the kind words!

The magic resist bug has been fixed. Your friend's report should be different now. As for the Rammus game, I couldn't see it when I looked. I'll keep an eye out for the bug, though. Thanks for the feedback!

How about now? I changed it up so you **should** be able to tell pretty easily at a glance whether it was a loss or a win.

I am not a fan of how your website currently works. I feel like it pushes too much influence onto k/d/a when in some roles having a meh kda is good. If I am playing a tank I should be the first one of any of my teammates dead in a team fight. I also won't be getting much kills as a tank either.

It appears to somewhat take into account a predefined role of the champion you play, when instead it should be more champion specific. For instance see my attached screen shot. I played Janna that game and it gave me marks off because Thresh had more damage taken than me. Considering Janna sits on the backline while Thresh tanks the frontline, he should definitely have taken more damage than me.

Same goes for the marks it took off because Thresh dealt more damage than I did as Janna. Seriously? lol. 

Another game I looked at I played Riven top and it chose my adversary as the TF mid. It then proceeded to tell me I was bronze Riven because I took more damage than TF did. Of course melee champions will take more damage than ranged.

Damage taken honestly shouldn't be used / compared to your adversary's. It criticised me for having more damage taken as jungle kha zix than the enemy jungle amumu just because kha zix is considered an assasin and therefore shouldn't be tanking damage. 

Amumu had only 1 less death than me. If I have way more damage taken than my opponent, and yet our deaths are still comparable, it means I did a better job than him. I was able to absorb more damage than my opponent while still not dying. Deaths should absolutely matter when it comes to total damage taken.

I also like this one "Your gold earned this match was less than your adversarry's. Try farming more" even though my cs was double my adversarry's that game. If you lost the game you are likely to have less gold than your opponent unless you really outplayed your opponent. Global gold is strong.

Also your website doesn't track jungle cs, only lane cs. This vastly skews the results for junglers.

That is all I saw at a quick glance, hope that info helps make your website better.

It does seem like a calculation is necessary for damage taken. It's been mentioned before, namely on soak champs like Vlad. But really if you're taking high amounts of damage, it is worth taking into account that you're spending less time on the battlefield even if you don't die. Where you could see it as being an asset to the team, another could see it as being a liability. There are exceptions (such as Vlad, Trynd, Mao, etc.), but for the most part there is a reason for challenger ranked players taking the damage they do as an average. If you're compared to them and it's specific to your champion, it's not a matter of opinion per se, it's more of a matter of play style. If you're wanting to be challenger, take the advice and run with it. If you're not, then don't.

Gold earned is a global amount, with everything taken into consideration. Whether it means you need to farm more or not, it's there. It's calculated based on how much a pro would have earned. Again, if you think you're on your way to challenger without adopting the average pros' playstyles, don't take the advice.

CS is not calculated, it's **given** to the website from Riot.

You're putting a lot of emphasis on KDA, when it's one factor out of many. Also, if it's an average of pros, it doesn't matter if you're tanking. Even in theory alone (taking pro averages out of the equation) as a tank you get more assists than anyone, resulting in a good KDA if played properly. 

Will take it all into consideration, however.

Thanks.

> You're putting a lot of emphasis on KDA, when it's one factor out of many. Also, if it's an average of pros, it doesn't matter if you're tanking.

Literally my second sentence was telling you to stop putting so much emphasis on k/d/a. If it sounds like I put so much emphasis on it, it is because of how much your site put an emphasis on it.

As for damage taken, you are thinking too narrowly about the cause and effect of damage taken and skill. Co-relation is not causation. Damage taken as a stat should never be looked at solely by itself.

> Literally my second sentence was telling you to stop putting so much emphasis on k/d/a. If it sounds like I put so much emphasis on it, it is because of how much your site put an emphasis on it.

If the website has multiple stats, and in one circumstance (as it fluctuates per match) you have 7 other alerts, how exactly is the website "putting so much emphasis" on KDA? Is 12.5% heavy emphasis? Again, if you don't want your KDA being compared to Challenger averages, don't look. You're fixated on one piece of a much larger puzzle.

> As for damage taken, you are thinking too narrowly about the cause and effect of damage taken and skill. Co-relation is not causation. Damage taken as a stat should never be looked at solely by itself.

That's partially accurate. In most standard matches, your damage taken **is** linear and reflects your ability to stay out when necessary. Soak champions are an exception, and so are tanks. For ADCs, however, it's **extremely** linear. Higher damage taken on a glassy champ means less time in the battle. If you don't believe that, look at the matches you are questioning. When your damage taken is higher *as a carry*, is your gold earned less than your adversary's? Is it lower than the average Challenger? Trust me, I've run thousands of reports to get averages of damage between every tier of play and the metrics I'm presently using are the result of that. As has been mentioned a few times, the red flags for certain champs (Trynd, Mao, Vlad, etc.) when they receive more damage is not accurate. Exceptions aside, having less damage taken across the board equates to better games. If what you were telling me were true, you'd be Challenger and the Challenger data I've harvested over the past months would coincide with what you're saying. You're literally arguing with statistics. My website simply tells you whether you outperformed your adversary and a challenger in your shoes based on multiple different metrics. I'm not thousands of Challengers. I'm not millions of other players. I did not *create* these statistics, I collected them.

BTW, you will never see Damage Taken looked at "solely by itself". In fact, if you find a single report containing only Damage Taken (and rating your match based solely on it, by itself) send me a screenshot. We'll talk then.

This is why each match has it's own overall rating. Sometimes you'll do great with a sub-par KDA, or with more damage taken than your adversary or a Challenger average. In those matches, if everything else is done well, you'll still receive high marks.

It seems to me you don't like how your report is showing and directing that frustration to my website. That's fine, don't use it. Some people can't handle being told their KDA was below the Challenger averages. Some people can't handle being told their Damage Taken for their champ was higher/lower than Challenger averages. Some people can't handle being told their lane opponent outperformed them in certain aspects. I'm not catering to those people. I have no interest in giving out fortune cookies to the soft hearted.

>-Your KDA was lower than your adversary’s.
-Your damage dealt to champions is lower than your adversary’s. 
-Your damage taken is higher than your adversary’s. 
-The enemy team built tanky, but you did not counter them with penetration. 
-Your gold earned this match was lower than your adversary’s.

This report was from your Lucian game. Trust me, **this match was not rated based on *one* stat**. 

>-Your KDA was lower than your adversary’s. 
-Your damage dealt to champions is lower than your adversary’s. 
-Your damage taken is lower than your adversary’s. That is good.
-The enemy team built tanky, and you countered them.
-Your gold earned this match was lower than your adversary’s.

If you were correct, this match wouldn't be rated Challenger. Your KDA, Damage Dealt, and Gold are all lower than your adversary's. You still got Challenger.

Hello again. I see you've added some new features such as the per game rank analysis and removed the CC time. Im curious as to why im now predicted with mid Gold as my highest possible rank when all of my games but 2 are Plat or above, going as far as challenger level play in two and most being Diamond.


Also, in http://slashlaugh.com/?s=49960472&n=Frosch%20Senpai , 5th game from the bottom which is currently a Lulu game win, it seems to have not been able to detect an opponent.\

Edit: Also the first game currently a win on Thresh.

Edit2: and for that matter the last game, currently a win on Syndra vs Heimerdinger, shows Heimer building 12 items not including his 2 trinkets, several of which are AD items.

I'm glad to see you're still checking back!

I totally re-vamped the entire rank analysis system last night. I'm about 95% done with it, just need to put some finishing touches on it. The part required is essentially just seeing the result from a massive range of players over time. In fact, your rating analysis has changed dramatically as well. It now has you at a more reasonable estimate. Check it now and tell me what you think.

I'm not able to see the two occurrences you refer to in your edits. Though, I do know that now and then an adversary won't be detected and causes weird display issues. I'll keep investigating that issue.

Thanks for your feedback! Let me know what you think of your rating now.
It doesnt seem to calculate CC time correctly, as my opponent always has thousands of seconds and I only have a couple hundred. Also, it doesnt seem to be able to rank my friend KrowSoulEater at all.

Indeed. Your report shows some obscene numbers on your Adversaries. Will be working on this. Thank you for bringing that up!

Your friend's report also seems to be showing a weird bug. I'll get back to you when both of these are fixed.

Thanks again for pointing these out.

np, you asked for bug testers so thats what im doing =P ive been doing reports for everyone i know and everyone i play against. I think this is a great learning tool for a lot of people and i want to see it succeed.

Great news everyone. The app was approved and the rate limit is quite a bit higher. Feel free to test it out!

http://www.slashlaugh.com

It doesn't look amazing and the website has very limited features. Please give me any feedback on error you encounter and such.

Looking forward to seeing the feedback!
I like the feature where you can see CC time. I want to see it with my stats, when will you release it?

To be perfectly honest I'm simply waiting for approval from Riot to get a full API key. Once that happens it'll be released for Beta testing. I'm assuming it should be fairly soon, possibly even this coming week.

Very nice!
Its not the most indepth but it is great at pointing out some things that are certainly helpful!
Looking forward to seeing this developed beyond the current scope!
And as mentioned before, taking warding into consideration would be great!
I bookmarked it!

Wards coming soon!

Thanks for the kind words :) Hope you'll join the SL community when it goes live!

Dude, I give you mad props for your website; It's friggin' sweet!!

I find the information to match my own estimates regarding skill level in the three levels provided by the website.  Furthermore, I like the presentation of the data and the form of accolades that describe exactly why you performed at the measured skill level.
 Very well done in my opinion.  Nice! 
I'm definitely going to keep tabs on this :)

Thank you very much for the kind words!

I hope you join the community when it's up and running :)

I've been making a lot of updates recently so check back often and let me know what you think.
Places to much emphasis on KDA. This isn't CoD KDA doesn't win games objectives due despite what most of this retarded community thinks.

Teach me Goldie XD

You must be friends with the kid that was saying it was placing emphasis on KDA earlier. Feel free to read the responses there. One metric out of many others is not a lot of emphasis. If you don't like that KDA matters, then don't look.

The fact is feeding doesn't help your team. What metric is used to determine if you'r feeding? KDA. Not helping in team fights does not help your team either. What metric is used to determine if you're not participating with the team? KDA. If you're not tanking for your team as a tank you're not helping your team. What metric is used to determine if you're not tanking? KDA.

The list goes on, but I'm sure you're not actually reading any of this. You're just trying to think up some silly response as to why you're ranked so low. If you don't want to be compared to Pro Averages, don't look. Live in your blissful little bubble where Gold is Challenger. You're where you are because of the rest of the world, not because of you/your actions.
Already a very cool site. Keep it up! I'll be following it for future references.

"This account has probably been boosted"

:^)

thank you for this website though I love it and will be checking for future updates
I keep getting a number, and no report.
Not sure why that's happening. I'll do some digging and figure out what's wrong with it. Thanks for bringing that to my attention!

Wow! Color me impressed, your picked up on my AP Ezreal going mid and compared me to the right opponent.

I know for me one of the things that keeps me where I am is I don't play enough ranked. Perhaps you could add some sort of "average days between games/days since last game" stat?

Edit: looked up a Diamond 5 friend and your stats day he's trending for low silver. Looks like things might need some work with higher elos

I have a bit of a gripe. It seems that every game that I end up losing, I get bottom bronze. Thing is, if i win, I suddenly get High Plat. But then I looked at some Masters and Challengers, and I could NOT stop laughing!!! EVERY SINGLE GAME SAYS BOTTOM BRONZE!!!
Maybe we're not so bad after all!
You can lose and get a good rank, but you have to do well despite your loss.

The challenger games you're referring to simply had a bug. Their performance was literally **so good** that it was out of range. The bug is fixed now.

If you lose games that you perform bad in, it makes sense. You're less likely to lose if you're doing well. Your match rank is not dictated by win or loss, but the exact opposite is typically true.

It seems to have totally screwed the system. Everyone is seeding now and all my games are now rated around silver, unless thats intended? I feel its not since Dyrus and Man DInh are having similar results.
Aye. Riot has reset all ranks, as preseason is among us!

This is seriously phenomenal!

I think it's great so far. Can't wait to see what else comes from this. Good idea.
As far as  cosmetics go, what are your plans for it? It'd be cool if you could rock the splash art from your most played champs. Might be a pain though.

I've never done rank. It says I am low Bronze; but I know I would place gold when I rank (I win almost every gold in custom 1v1s, and have incredibly high win rates with my mains)

So I don't know how well it works for non-ranked players.

It only takes stats from ranked games. I don't think it's saying that you'd place in bronze so much as it's saying there is no data for you. It may be something the dev would put in.

Also, keep in mind this isn't a 1v1 game. It's a team game and team play matters very much. :) That being said, you should try out some ranked this season, it would be cool to see where you land.
The matches on my report are all from like two weeks ago, and they all seem to be my poorer games. What's going on?
It gathers your most recent 10 matches on Solo Queue 5x5 (ranked).
Oh it's only ranked? That explains it xD.
Yeah in the future it will do more, but currently that's the only functionality it provides.
